title: Tesla drives retail sales higher at Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield malls
text:
Tesla car sales have bolstered retail returns across malls in Europe and the US for Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield, the global mall group that took over Westfield last year.

With stronger tenant sales and footfall growth across its portfolio, Unibail has told investors – in a third-quarter earnings update – that it expects to deliver earnings at the upper end of its guidance.

US singer John Legend performs at the rebranding of Paris' Quatre Temps mall as a Westfield this year.

A portion of the Unibail stock trades on the Australian Securities Exchange through an instrument known as CHESS Depositary Interests and its securities are covered by local analysts.

Its local stock closed higher, rising 10¢ or 0.9 per cent, to close at $11,.60 on Tuesday.

For the third quarter, the shopping centre landlord reported tenant sales "were up strongly by 5.2 per cent" in continental Europe and by more than 5.5 per cent in its flagship malls.
description: With stronger tenant sales and footfall growth across its portfolio, Unibail expects to deliver earnings at the upper end of its guidance.
